column4: hi all! Is there anything like "/etc/init.d/iptables save" or other iptables - save/restore auto script in ubuntu?
type iptab then press tab a few times, see what comes out
i got 3Mb as my highest which is xorg. Try closing it then reopening it. See if it happens again. Do you use hibernate etc?
its not in the top 20 anyhoo
find in terminal is pretty sweet, or you can run: sudo updatedb   then use the locate command to find files
find has an age option in it
I just wanted anything with graphical UI :-(
because I thought ubuntu has made a step towards the usability .. at last :(
there are searching apps but I don'y knoe them personally. find is very usable...
ust because you are  typing stuff doesn't make it not usable...
sudo find/ -type f -mtime +3       willfind all files older than 3 days...
yes it does make it less usable since you have to dig in man pages instead of just clicking and doing it
there are sample commands online, that's where I got that. never used a man page
if you can learn CLI stuff, it will benefit you later
yep I've googled-out the solution: 1. create a temp file, touch it to DATE1, 2. create a second tmp file with DATE2, then find -cnewer ./date1 ... ! -cnewer ./date2... yep, THATS user friendly!?!
